description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2magt","text":"This protocol is designed for extracting DNA from pan trap-collected invertebrates for biomonitoring and community metabarcoding to identify and quantify ecosystem service and disservice providers. The reagents and methods proposed offer a cost effective and high-throughput method for molecular diversity analyses of bulk samples using standard lab equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9kuq","text":"Add all of the sample solution (~ 600 μL) to a well in a 96-well silica membrane spin-column plate and cover with a breathable seal. {"blocks":[{"key":"59auj","text":"Add three 3 mm hardened carbon steel beads to the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3958h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ba50t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"322en","text":"Beads are usually shipped coated in manufacturing oil (especially the carbon steel beads). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4co38","text":"Two lysis options are presented below. One standard protocol using Proteinase K to lyse a subsample of each trap (this may reduce detectable diversity but increases efficiency), and the other uses papain (a cheap alternative to Proteinase K) to lyse whole samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnd7d","text":"Set a pan trap at approximately the same height as the surrounding vegetation. {"blocks":[{"key":"bnesb","text":"Fill the traps with water containing detergent to reduce surface tension. {"blocks":[{"key":"5ol5t","text":"Pour the trap contents through a sterilised funnel into a suitably sized pot labelled with all necessary sample information for transport to the laboratory. {"blocks":[{"key":"5h40n","text":"Directly from the freezer, grind the bulk samples in a tissue grinder/homogeniser/lyser at 1750 RPM for 4 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ftag","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55a2u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4mvpn","text":"If the sample is not fully homogenised, repeat this step.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dm9b","text":"Take a subsample of 1 mL lysate from the supernatant and transfer it to a 2.2 mL 96-well plate. {"blocks":[{"key":"bv1b9","text":"Vortex each sample to mix and incubate at 37 °C overnight (12-16 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn50b","text":"Vortex to mix and centrifuge at 4,000 x g for 4 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"boin7","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000 x g for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36hos","text":"Grind the samples in a Geno/Grinder at full speed (1750 RPM) for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekp1s","text":"Decide how samples will be distributed across plates (but don't distribute DNA yet). Consider including a negative control in each row and column to detect any contaminants in each tagged forward and reverse primer. Among these wells, include any DNA extraction negative controls. Include positive controls (ideally mixed samples of species not found in the same study system), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns). Include blank controls (ideally wells into which no reagents or at least no primers are added), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpilu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d178t","text":"If using multiple PCR primer pairs, familiarise yourself with the annealing temperatures for each and prepare separate PCR plates for each. For optimal accuracy, consider running replicates of each reaction (e.g., triplicates).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gpui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rpkk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":283,"id":402253,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"cenq3\",\"text\":\"Example layout of samples and controls in a 96-well plate.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Untitled (8).png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4rbjzkf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4pbjzkf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4qbjzkf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4nbjzkf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3f6om","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8h57","text":"Optimal bioinformatics workflows depend on a variety of factors including target taxa, study system, the genetic marker used, computational resources available and various other factors. Other resources with code integration will be much better suited to detailing the steps involved. The process will likely follow a similar progression of steps though:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5um8m","text":"Read processing: demultiplex, trim primers, merge pairs.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chj5a","text":"Filtering and error correction: quality filtering, dereplication, denoising, chimera filtering.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe2i4","text":"Taxonomic unit aggregation: OTU/ASV delimitation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q5sg","text":"Taxon assignment: reference database curation, taxon assignment.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

This reduces evaporation and thus loss of product, but also reduces potential contamination.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr0s4","text":"Prepare enough PCR mastermix for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sn8g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b87ks","text":"For a full plate, these values will usually suffice (with some overage to account for pipetting error), but check your specific Taq polymerase mix for any differences:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t9fd","text":"        Volume","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"al87b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16dqo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1iqmo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[200,126],"data":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["Molecular grade water (DNase free)","422.4"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","528"]],"guid":"BAC262A62D69429FBEDE99C7AAA1DFC2","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["Molecular grade water (DNase free)","422.4"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","528"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"49guv","text":"These values are for 10 µL reaction volumes, which have been demonstrated to be effective for bulk samples. Consider running them in triplicate for more accurate results.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tkh9","text":"For ease, if able to use a 96-well pipette, consider creating a \"primer plate\" containing both PCR primers for each well at 5 µM concentration; this is especially effective when using multiple plates. Add 7.75 µL mastermix to each well, followed by 1.25 µL of each primer mix to its corresponding well. It is possible to use this strategy with a multi-channel or even single-channel pipette, but the suggestion immediately below may be easier. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pa2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bijpk","text":"If not using a 96-well pipette, consider making eight mastermixes each with sufficient reagents for 12 samples (7.75 µL mastermix per well, so 97.65 µL for 12 with some overage for pipetting error), each containing a different forward primer (with 0.625 µL of 5 µM forward primer per well, so 7.875 µL per mastermix for 12 with some overage for pipetting error). Distribute 8.375 µL of forward primer + mastermix to each well across the rows corresponding to each forward primer. Then distribute 0.625 µL of reverse primer to each well in the corresponding columns making sure to change pipette tip for each sample to avoid cross-contaminating the forward primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":565,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btt05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kksf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":412,"id":402259,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9fm4h\",\"text\":\"Distribution of tagged PCR primers across the 96-well plate\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Untitled (9).png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4xbjzkf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4vbjzkf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4wbjzkf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4ubjzkf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"403i5","text":"Add 1 µL DNA to each corresponding sample and positive control well, and 1 µL molecular grade water to each negative control other than extraction negative controls (which will be added as samples).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mm9s","text":"Briefly centrifuge the plate to ensure that the oil is above the PCR mix and everything is at the bottom of each well without air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"behi6","text":"Load the PCR plate into a thermocycler. Ensure that the temperature regime matches the enzyme used (including any heat activation for hot-start Taq) and that the annealing temperature matches the PCR primers used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asbpj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du9od","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b81kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4qi1c","text":"Given differences between labs and sample material, and inaccuracies in temperature calibration, considering running a temperature gradient PCR with known samples to check optimal temperatures first if unsure.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f4vfg","text":"Incubate at RT for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2jgjt","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drp3n","text":"Add 20 µL of PCR product (or whatever volume of beads was used in the last step) to each corresponding well of 0.1X beads, avoiding oil, and mix by vortexing (1500 RPM for 1 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdasd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgub2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bidc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"h1d3","text":"To avoid pipetting oil from the oil-sealed PCR products, plunge the pipette to the first stop and fully insert the pipette tip into the bottom of the well, then release sharply. The PCR product will be taken up quickly, whereas the relatively viscous oil will be taken up slowly, thus being outcompeted by the PCR product.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et41i","text":"If using beads such as Sera-Mag Magnetic SpeedBeads (carboxylated, 1 µm, 3 EDAC/PA5), take 1 mL of well-mixed bead solution and wash the beads twice with TE+Tween buffer (10 mM Tris base, 1 mM EDTA, 0.05% Tween 20, pH 8.0) by magnetising the beads, removing the supernatant, adding the TE+Tween, remagnetising the beads and removing the supernatant, and repeating the addition and removal of TE+Tween once more.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aejrs","text":"To the beads, add the following mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qkj3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9sdtv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",null],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"]],"guid":"820B11EA611E4394A9D67040EFD5388E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"p19e","text":"Add 20 mL of 50 % PEG to the tube to reach a 1X bead solution (alongside making the 0.1X solution, this will be useful later).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e38ch","text":"Remove all but 5 µL of the mixture from each well via pipette without disturbing the beads, which should be settled on the magnet (although can be hard to see with 0.1X bead solutions).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3i96s","text":"Add 200 µL 80 % ethanol to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52g4","text":"Remove the ethanol and add a further 200 µL 80 % ethanol to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o9j1","text":"Remove the ethanol as completely as possible by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rrvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvbtf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4o0jl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b8t2c","text":"A small amount of remaining ethanol isn't debilitating in this case, unlike usual magnetic bead cleaning protocols, because we will complete a subsequent purification immediately after.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6d5qb","text":"Add 10 µL molecular grade water to each well, shake at 1500 RPM for 1 min and incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"81d6m","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8782v","text":"Pool 8 µL from each well into a single tube, leaving magnetic beads behind in the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q8nk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rkgv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93dns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6j6fs","text":"To pool samples using a multi-channel pipette, pipette each column of samples into a new strip of 200 µL tubes, then merge all of these tubes into a single 1.5 mL tube at the end.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"493cg","text":"Mix the pooled samples by flicking and inverting, and transfer 700 µL into a new 2.5 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh84g","text":"Add 700 µL 1X magnetic beads for DNA purification (see note below for size selection) and mix by vortexing. Incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"796nk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpqnt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmrio","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"en7cg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6tthp","text":"This is a good opportunity for size selection as well, especially if the PCR product contains any secondary bands. If using amplicons around 350 bp, consider a 0.8X bead ratio (i.e., add 560 µL beads instead).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5d87","text":"The samples should now be checked for successful amplification, contamination in negatives and any secondary banding. Gel electrophoresis will achieve this, but digital systems like the Qiagen Qiaxcel will do this and facilitate equalisation by generating amplicon-specific DNA concentations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2oeme","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e9b0l","text":"Add 400 µL 80 % ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cpjg3","text":"Remove the ethanol and add a further 400 µL 80 % ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8kq3","text":"Remove the ethanol completely. Briefly centrifuge the sample to collect and remove any residual ethanol. Allow to air-dry until the aggregation of magnetic beads transitions from 'glossy' (shiny reflection of light) to 'matte' (dull dark brown mass), but not so long that it dries completely (i.e., begins to turn a rusty red and shows cracks).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e90ck","text":"Add 100 µL molecular grade water and mix by vortexing. Incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8lmfi","text":"Place the sample on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ovgp","text":"Remove 95 µL of the water and place it in a new tube. This will be the library used in the subsequent section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4gij","text":"Dilute library to ≤5 ng/µL in molecular grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ohdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btln","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9eet1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2huea","text":"Without diluting the library, there is a risk that the adapters will not be added to all DNA (i.e., there is too much DNA) which will compromise the sequencing yield.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qop8","text":"Add a drop of mineral oil to one PCR tube for each library, alongside an additional tube for a negative control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f3j6","text":"Per library, assemble the following reaction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hcb8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ekvps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"guid":"CC1E642ADEA042DABD0E9E82D68256D4","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6fv2i","text":"Briefly centrifuge the tubes to ensure that the oil is above the PCR mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20g21","text":"Load the PCR reactions into a thermocycler. Ensure that the temperature regime matches the enzyme used (including any heat activation for hot-start Taq) and that the annealing temperature matches the PCR primers used. Run for 12 cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34a95","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2chp9","text":"Check that the adapters have been added to the DNA by determining and comparing the amplicon sizes for libraries before and after this second PCR. Amplicons should be longer after the second PCR. This is ideally assessed using a digital system like TapeStation, but even gel electrophoresis will work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4151","text":"Once successful adapter addition is confirmed, libraries can be pooled so that each is equimolar in the final mixture based on the concentrations determined above (e.g., by Qubit).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmko4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p26g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"rsmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"88plh","text":"This can be achieved by dividing the maximum concentration across the libraries by each library concentration and pooling that many µL from each. These values may need to be multiplied up to ensure adequate yield for sequencing.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5d86s","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2mq6k","text":"Be careful if using multiple PCR primer pairs! Different amplicons have different molecular weights, so pool based on fmol rather than ng/µL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq5bf","text":"Check with your sequencing provider how many fmol they will need in how many µL. This will be based on the sequencer, sequencing cartridge and any QC processes they follow. The libraries should be ready for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v0bu","text":"If the PCRs were replicated (i.e., each sample run multiple times for each PCR primer pair used), these can be merged together into one plate at this point, or carried forward separately. Keeping the replicates separate increases the number of libraries to prepare and sequence later, but better facilitates identification of inconsistencies between samples. To merge triplicates, assuming use of 10 µL reaction volumes, pipette 8 µL from each well of two of the three plates into the corresponding well of the third. Briefly centrifuge the merged plate to move the oil to the top of the product again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44a7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"223qs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gto","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"h1d3","text":"To avoid pipetting oil from the oil-sealed PCR products, plunge the pipette to the first stop and fully insert the pipette tip into the bottom of the well, then release sharply. The PCR product will be taken up quickly, whereas the relatively viscous oil will be taken up slowly, thus being outcompeted by the PCR product.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60e0d","text":"Add 5 mL of 1X bead solution to 45 mL of the following mix to make a 0.1X solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46k4i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26c1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"],["50 % PEG","20 mL"]],"guid":"0482DDA2A60C45589755DE93B06372E3","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"],["50 % PEG","20 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blbn2","text":"If ≥20 µL of PCR product is available in each well, pipette 20 µL of 0.1X SPRI bead solution into each well of a new 96-well plate. If less DNA is available, add the available volume of 0.1X SPRI beads and add the same volume of PCR product to these beads in the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q6jq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emscm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fuc4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26tdl","text":"When working with magnetic beads, ensure they are fully mixed with no residue at the bottom of the container.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ce7j","text":"Decide how samples will be distributed across plates (but don't distribute the DNA yet). Consider including a negative control in each row and column to detect any contaminants in each tagged forward and reverse primer. Among these wells, include any DNA extraction negative controls. Include positive controls (ideally mixed samples of species not found in the same study system), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns). Include blank controls (ideally wells into which no reagents or at least no primers are added), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20prj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94om7","text":"If using multiple PCR primer pairs, familiarise yourself with the annealing temperatures for each and prepare separate PCR plates for each. For optimal accuracy, consider running replicates of each reaction (e.g., triplicates).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aneok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q1gb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":283,"id":402263,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Untitled (8).png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni43bjzkf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4zbjzkf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni42bjzkf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni4ybjzkf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61e7e","text":"Distribute one drop of mineral oil into each well of the PCR plate (~20 µL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8siqe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h6sp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76u88","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9i8q8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fgvh5","text":"This can be achieved by taking a large volume of mineral oil into the pipette tip and then gently plunging so that a drop forms and falls from the tip into each well.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4uasa","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bu906","text":"Mineral oil improves sealing of reactions by preventing evaporation and condensation. This reduces evaporation and thus loss of product, but also reduces potential contamination.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amo9v","text":"Prepare enough PCR mastermix for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t039","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2deta","text":"For a full plate, these values will usually suffice (with some overage to account for pipetting error), but check your specific Taq polymerase mix for any differences:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35kea","text":"        Volume","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"45cjc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cv2o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"221k0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[200,126],"data":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["Molecular grade water (DNase free)","422.4"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","528"]],"guid":"BAC262A62D69429FBEDE99C7AAA1DFC2","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume (μL)"],["Molecular grade water (DNase free)","422.4"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","528"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"49guv","text":"These values are for 10 µL reaction volumes, which have been demonstrated to be effective for bulk samples. Consider running them in triplicate for more accurate results.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b71j","text":"For ease, if able to use a 96-well pipette, consider creating a \"primer plate\" containing both PCR primers for each well at 5 µM concentration; this is especially effective when using multiple plates. Add 7.75 µL mastermix to each well, followed by 1.25 µL of each primer mix to its corresponding well. It is possible to use this strategy with a multichannel pipette, but the next suggestion may be easier. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asbhc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2v6n","text":"If not using a 96-well pipette, consider making eight mastermixes each with sufficient reagents for 12 samples (7.75 µL mastermix per well, so 97.65 µL for 12 with some overage for pipetting error), each containing a different forward primer (with 0.625 µL of 5 µM forward primer per well, so 7.875 µL per mastermix for 12 with some overage for pipetting error). Distribute 8.375 µL of forward primer + mastermix to each well across the rows corresponding to each forward primer. Then distribute 0.625 µL of reverse primer to each well in the corresponding columns making sure to change pipette tip for each sample to avoid cross-contaminating the forward primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":565,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4klhl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"878u7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":412,"id":402267,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"bm0t4\",\"text\":\"Distribution of tagged PCR primers across the 96-well plate\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"primers.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni47bjzkf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni45bjzkf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni46bjzkf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ni44bjzkf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsfri","text":"Add 1 µL DNA to each corresponding sample or positive control well, and 1 µL molecular grade water to each negative control other than extraction negative control(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3rrq","text":"Briefly centrifuge the plate to ensure that the oil is above the PCR mix and everything is at the bottom of each well without air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86h1c","text":"Load the PCR plate into a thermocycler. Ensure that the temperature regime matches the enzyme used (including any heat activation for hot-start Taq) and that the annealing temperature matches the PCR primers used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c89a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h5t2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3oj1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4qi1c","text":"Given differences between labs and samples, and inaccuracies in temperature calibration, considering running a temperature gradient PCR with known samples to check it works.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e13hn","text":"The samples should now be checked for successful amplification, contamination in negatives and any secondary banding. Gel electrophoresis will achieve this, but digital systems like the Qiagen Qiaxcel will do this and facilitate equalisation by generating amplicon-specific DNA concentations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chu7c","text":"If the PCRs were replicated (i.e., each sample run multiple times for each PCR primer pair used), these can be merged together into one plate at this point, or carried forward separately. Keeping the replicates separate increases the number of libraries to prepare and sequence later, but better facilitates inconsistencies between samples. To merge triplicates, assuming use of 10 µL reaction volumes, pipette 8 µL from each well of two of the three plates into the corresponding well of the third. Briefly centrifuge the merged plate to move the oil to the top of the product again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l82m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1knvu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4a6tm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"h1d3","text":"To avoid pipetting oil from the oil-sealed PCR products, plunge the pipette to the first stop and fully insert the pipette tip into the bottom of the well, then release sharply. The PCR product will be taken up quickly, whereas the relatively viscous oil will be taken up slowly, thus being outcompeted by the PCR product.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fdhqt","text":"Prepare 0.1X SPRI bead solution and bring to room temperature. The below steps detail how to make this solution, but it is also commercially available.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d40he","text":"If ≥20 µL of PCR product is available in each well, pipette 20 µL of 0.1X SPRI bead solution into each well of a new 96-well plate. If less DNA is available, add the available volume of 0.1X SPRI beads and add the same volume of PCR product to these beads in the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s5cd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2khe6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2r864","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26tdl","text":"When working with magnetic beads, ensure they are fully mixed with no residue at the bottom of the container.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4unl3","text":"If using beads such as Sera-Mag Magnetic SpeedBeads (carboxylated, 1 µm, 3 EDAC/PA5), take 1 mL of well-mixed bead solution and wash the beads twice with TE+Tween buffer (10 mM Tris base, 1 mM EDTA, 0.05% Tween 20, pH 8.0) by magnetising the beads, removing the supernatant, adding the TE+Tween, remagnetising the beads and removing the supernatant, and repeating the addition and removal of TE+Tween once more.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"55k49","text":"To the beads, add the following mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2ork","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mvs3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",null],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"]],"guid":"820B11EA611E4394A9D67040EFD5388E","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2t7gc","text":"Add 20 mL of 50 % PEG to the tube to reach a 1X bead solution (alongside making the 0.1X solution, this will be useful later).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eprod","text":"Add 5 mL of 1X bead solution to 45 mL of the following mix to make a 0.1X solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7huf8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dep6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"],["50 % PEG","20 mL"]],"guid":"0482DDA2A60C45589755DE93B06372E3","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["5 M NaCl","25 mL"],["Molecular grade water","3.582 mL"],["1 N HCl","0.168 mL"],["1 M Tris base","0.5 mL"],["0.1 M disodium EDTA","0.5 mL"],["50 % PEG","20 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl1id","text":"Add 20 µL of PCR product (or whatever volume of beads was used in the last step) to each corresponding well of 0.1X beads, avoiding oil, and mix by vortexing (1500 RPM for 1 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m482","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99gnv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ct8o8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"h1d3","text":"To avoid pipetting oil from the oil-sealed PCR products, plunge the pipette to the first stop and fully insert the pipette tip into the bottom of the well, then release sharply. The PCR product will be taken up quickly, whereas the relatively viscous oil will be taken up slowly, thus being outcompeted by the PCR product.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f1kkm","text":"Incubate at RT for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5glis","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7i3oi","text":"Remove all but 5 uL of the mixture from each well via pipette without disturbing the beads, which should be settled on the magnet (although can be hard to see with 0.1X solutions).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2pe9n","text":"Add 200 µL 80 % ethanol to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8fic","text":"Remove the ethanol and add a further 200 µL 80 % ethanol to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31fq6","text":"Remove the ethanol as completely as possible by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gu11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnei6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hg6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b8t2c","text":"A small amount of remaining ethanol isn't debilitating in this case, unlike usual magnetic bead cleaning protocols, because we will complete a subsequent purification immediately after.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2ql1","text":"Add 10 µL molecular grade water to each well, shake at 1500 RPM for 1 min and incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4r487","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4npt4","text":"Pool 8 µL from each well into a single tube, leaving magnetic beads behind in the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ane9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fakek","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf83e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6j6fs","text":"To pool samples using a multi-channel pipette, pipette each column of samples into a new strip of 200 µL tubes, then merge all of these tubes into a single 1.5 mL tube at the end.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgegg","text":"Mix the pooled samples by flicking and inverting, and transfer 700 µL into a new 2.5 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86md2","text":"Add 700 µL 1X magnetic beads for DNA purification (see note below for size selection) and mix by vortexing. Incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iieu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqjuf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1dtq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6tthp","text":"This is a good opportunity for size selection as well, especially if the PCR product contains any secondary bands. If using ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"29l8k","text":"Place on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f3nt8","text":"Add 400 µL 80 % ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4en0d","text":"Remove the ethanol and add a further 400 µL 80 % ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83abu","text":"Remove the ethanol completely. Briefly centrifuge the sample to collect and remove any residual ethanol. Allow to air-dry until the aggregation of magnetic beads transitions from 'glossy' (shiny reflection of light) to 'matte' (dull dark brown mass), but not so long that it dries completely (i.e., begins to turn a rusty red and shows cracks).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t7sc","text":"Add 100 µL molecular grade water and mix by vortexing. Incubate for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2c1k4","text":"Place the sample on a magnetic stand for 5 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3egin","text":"Remove 95 µL of the water and place it in a new tube. This will be the library used in the subsequent section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qm9b","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8oh2","text":"Dilute library to ≤5 ng/µL in molecular grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eggii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aeu7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dkpt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2huea","text":"Without diluting the library, there is a risk that the adapters will not be added to all DNA (i.e., there is too much DNA) which will compromise the sequencing yield.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33btl","text":"Add a drop of mineral oil to one PCR tube for each library, alongside an additional tube for a negative control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfcpo","text":"Per library, assemble the following reaction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q2j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"498g6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhnq4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"guid":"CC1E642ADEA042DABD0E9E82D68256D4","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dffhi","text":"Briefly centrifuge the tubes to ensure that the oil is above the PCR mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8uh43","text":"Load the PCR reactions into a thermocycler. Ensure that the temperature regime matches the enzyme used (including any heat activation for hot-start Taq) and that the annealing temperature matches the PCR primers used. Run for 12 cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ob7v","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vka3","text":"Check that the adapters have been added to the DNA by determining and comparing the amplicon sizes for libraries before and after this second PCR. Amplicons should be longer after the second PCR. This is ideally assessed using a digital system like TapeStation, but even gel electrophoresis will work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6db0a","text":"Once successful adapter addition is confirmed, libraries can be pooled so that each is equimolar in the final mixture based on the concentrations determined above (e.g., by Qubit).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctv6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fm5it","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bm2b5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"88plh","text":"This can be achieved by dividing the maximum concentration across the libraries by each library concentration and pooling that many µL from each. These values may need to be multiplied up to ensure adequate yield for sequencing.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5d86s","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2mq6k","text":"Be careful if using multiple PCR primer pairs! Different amplicons have different molecular weights, so pool based on fmol rather than ng/µL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88ua9","text":"Check with your sequencing provider how many fmol they will need in how many µL. This will be based on the sequencer, sequencing cartridge and any QC processes they follow. The libraries should be ready for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95p6v","text":"Optimal bioinformatics workflows depend on a variety of factors including target taxa, study system, the genetic marker used, computational resources available and various other factors. Other resources with code integration will be much better suited to detailing the steps involved. The process will likely follow a similar progression of steps though:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edfq2","text":"Read processing: demultiplex, trim primers, merge pairs.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8dj9","text":"Filtering and error correction: quality filtering, dereplication, denoising, chimera filtering.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccivr","text":"Taxonomic unit aggregation: OTU/ASV delimitation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn34b","text":"Taxon assignment: reference database curation, taxon assignment.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtqfg","text":"Following taxon assignment to ASVs, taxa must be assigned as ecosystem service providers, ecosystem disservice providers, or neutral taxa.
